sub_title: Chief Engineer | Business Inteligence | Startup Scout | Mentor | Investor
summary:
For over 20 years I have been dedicated to international and multicultural large capital projects varying from Aerospace Industry, Government Contracts, Communication and Marketing&Sales consultancy.

As a Leader I inspire, engage, motivate and challenge my team and recognize their results. As a team member I am committed with my mission, engaged, cooperative and transparent on my reports.

My extensive, intensive and multisegmented career made me develop the ability to capture business requirements, processes and methods and translate into integrated solutions, lean and business centric systems. Also it helps me to develop the proficiency in multiple platforms, patterns and frameworks, and make me able to well Integrate solutions with the acquired helicopter view.

patents.title: Longitudinal lock device for cargo in aircraft, safety trigger for longitudinal lock device

projects.title: Great Place to Work Acreditation of Grupo Ivy
projects.description:
What a great pleasure of mine to be invited for one of the biggest challenges I do had in my professional career managing people, to plan, start, conduct and get a company certified as a Great Place to Work.

It was just feasible due to an awesome work did by Miller Augusto over the past decades as CEO of the Grupo Ivy.

A great company is made of great people, special thanks for Isa what such a great professional I do had opportunity to have next to me during this journey.

We had also structured a GPTW focal point team, which gave an incredible contribution.

Tips for the ones, who wants to get your company certified.

- People comes first.
- Understand who's your team
- Take a time to listen everyone at least 2x per year.
- Don't guess what your team wants to improve.
- Don't make palliative improvements, thinking your team buys.
- Do the required change, impact positivelly their lives.
- Be true
- Be honest
- Be open
- Don't promise things you can't do
- Build your culture based in respect
- Define and communicate your core values
- When hiring bear in mind the cultural fit of the candidate.

After some time of hard work you can apply and get Great Place to Work Acreditation.

projects.title: Human Factor Impacts your product/market
projects.description:
Human factors is something very important for the aerospace industry. 

When you are designing the user interface you are not just concerned about the user experience, but how they will interact with the interface in several scenarios of stress, tiredness or dangerous situation, for this industry the safety comes first.

Across many years I had the opportunity to use my aerospace and marketing knowledge to come up with solutions considering, visual aspect, robustness, usability, user experience and customer value proposition.

With a great design team I was able to provide solutions for new products and companies from different markets.

contributors.headline: Chief Engineer | Business Inteligence | Startup Scout | Mentor | Investor

projects.title: Modularity is the key for Time to Market
projects.description:
This project was lauched with several customers for their products and teams.

Using my diverse background I was able to support my customers to adopt a structured mentality and internal organization to keep almost 80% of communality among their products.

What they won? 

- Reduction in the supply chain lead time
- Reduction in the recurrent costs
- Reduction of the non-recurrent costs for new Product Development
- Competitiveness increased

Hence their time to market for new products is shorter than in the past and so the key for them upfront their competition.

contributors.headline: Chief Engineer | Business Inteligence | Startup Scout | Mentor | Investor

projects.title: Small changes high revenue impact
projects.description:
This was not an isolated project, across severeal yeras I had the opportunity to work with companies from all kind of markets, consumers, industrial, education, online markets, helping them to the better strategies to imptove their revenues by doing small changes in the organization.

I´ve implemented the sales funnel together with a CRM system and teach them how to bring their customers to the center of the business.

By using the customers business data, into a integrated analysis not just looking to the numbers but designing the customer journey, understanding their pains and anticipating their needs, following a growth hacking methodology I could promote small adjustments with a high impact on revenues.

We are united by purpose of promoting entrepreneurship through of collaboration and cooperation through the construction of a network of networking and smart investments. Come and joing us!
profile_positions.title: Member

profile_positions.description:
I bring extensive experience in coaching and mentoring engineers, ensuring impeccable engineering deliverables, and spearheading strategic initiatives for sustainable growth. With a sharp focus on commercial agreements, risk management, and market anticipation, I consistently contribute to the success of numerous projects while fostering a culture of excellence within the engineering community.

Coaching and mentoring engineers at all levels is a key strength of mine. By providing guidance and support, I empower new and senior engineers to excel in their roles, resulting in improved performance and enhanced team productivity. As the gatekeeper of engineering technical deliverables, I meticulously review and approve all engineering outputs. My attention to detail and unwavering commitment to quality assurance ensure that projects meet or exceed industry standards. Through this rigorous process, I foster a culture of excellence and accountability within the engineering team.

By striking a balance between business goals and engineering requirements, I facilitate smooth collaboration and the achievement of project objectives. As a proficient trainer, I enhance the technical capabilities of the engineering community. This investment in continuous learning ensures the team remains at the forefront of technological advancements and maintains a competitive edge.

Supporting business development efforts, I actively participate in potential customer meetings, where I effectively communicate the value proposition of our engineering solutions, leading to successful partnerships and new business opportunities. Understanding customer needs and aligning them with our engineering capabilities contributes to the organization's sustained growth.
In addition to my core responsibilities, I actively participate in European Commission projects focused on sustainability.I fulfill regulatory requirements and contribute to the organization's reputation as a socially responsible entity.
profile_positions.title: Chief Engineer(Technical Authority) deputy

profile_positions.description:
With my expertise in aerospace product development, particularly in Electrical Wiring Interconnection Systems (EWIS), my time at GKN AEROSPACE FOKKER ELMO has been dedicated to supporting customers, collaborating with engineers, and driving new developments while ensuring compliance and qualification.
Applying Lean design thinking and Agile methodologies, such as JIRA (Scrum), I have successfully delivered innovative solutions and managed projects within strict timelines. Leading the technical procurement process for new product development, I oversee the supplier relationship from RFQ to Statement of Work, ensuring adherence to project schedules and milestones up to the project closure.

Supporting the business line, I assist in technical presentations, commercial proposals, and work breakdown structures. I excel in coordinating and integrating with suppliers and customers across the globe, including China, France, Germany, UK, Netherlands, Sweden, Canada, US, Turkey, and India.

My experience includes valuable support in FAA and EASA EWIS certification processes. I excel in product requirement management, capturing, writing, validating, and verifying specifications. Additionally, I perform trade studies, define product market strategies, and establish collaborative opportunities with international partners.

I am skilled in devising strategies for product qualification and certification. I have authored technical reports, including Test Plans, Test Reports, and Qualification by Similarity documents. Furthermore, I possess expertise in multiphysics transient analysis, project management, risk mitigation, FMEA methodologies, and High Voltage (HVDC/HVAC) applications in Aircraft Electrification.

Notably, I successfully developed an electrical power feeder for an aircraft High Voltage power plant, completing the project in a remarkable six months. This accomplishment showcases my ability to drive efficiency while maintaining the highest standards of quality.
profile_positions.title: Sr. Electrical Wiring Interconnection System Design Engineer

profile_positions.location: São José dos Campos Area, Brazil
profile_positions.description: I’ve joined the team to work with System Simulation in MATLAB, however due to my strong background with System Design and Integration, I’ve assumed the full development of the Cargo Handling System focused in electrical architecture. The complete system had more than 6.000 interconnections composed of more than 100 LRUS, including several suppliers. The following devices were under my responsibility and integrated to the system by me: • Loadmaster Control Station (Including the UX[system synoptic] development) • Human Factor philosophy • Electro-mechanical locks • Electrical Control Panels • Video System • Parachute Deployment Mechanism • Cargo Winch • Gate release mechanism • Warning Bell System Procurement process starting at preparation of System Basic Data, Statement of Work, Program Deliverables, Commercial negotiations, Project Plan, Milestones and Gates definition; Development of System architecture, harness, ICDs, System description, LRU Installation, EMC segregation; Coordination and Integration with several systems which interfaces to CHS, leading the integrated product development with Multidisciplinary Design Engineering teams, being in total of 60 different engineers; Requirement management; Leading PDR, CDR and Design Reviews; DO160G qualification and certification, Vibration, Altitude, Temperature Variation, HIRF, Lightning, Salt fog, humidity, waterproofness, etc; Successful working relationship with both internal and external staff (suppliers); EWIS electrical hardware (BOM) procurement and selection. Ground and Flight Test campaign; Trade-studies; Flight test activities, Test Proposal report, Test Results, FTI definition; Coordination with military customers, suppliers, and interdepartmental personnel; This development required a high level of integration which I have overcome successfully.
profile_positions.title: Cargo Handling System Engineer (CHS)

profile_positions.description: As Avionics System Engineer, I was responsible for Datalink Communication with focus in the recorders, Cockpit Voice Recorder (CVR) and Flight Data Recorder (FDR). Being in charge for the development of a new ADS/CPDLC to comply with a new regulation requirement from the certification authorities ANAC/FAA/EASA. This feature was categorized as a major development following the proper development and certification tests as well as the compliance demonstration rigor. • Requirement Management (Capturing, Writing, Validation and Verification); • Writing reports like Test Plan, Test Results, Qualification report, Compliance verification; • Analysis of qualification according to DO-160 for several system components; • Discussions and Negotiation with Product Certification Authorities; • Test Rig and Flight Test; • Supplier procurement and management; • Risk assessment and management; • Trade studies considering product lifecycle; • Project management; • Field service bulletin strategy definition, Integrating the following departments, product support, customer support, technical publications, quality, contract administration and supplier; • Integration of multidisciplinary design engineering groups. Achievement: The biggest challenge on this role was the development of a tool capable to de-codify an encrypted uplink message recorded into the Cockpit Voice Recorder. That time nobody within the company had the knowledge to do that, and it was demanded by the certification authority that the company had this capability regardless any software that could open such messages. I have developed a process and a user-friendly tool capable to open the encrypted messages. This was one of my legacies left to the company.
profile_positions.title: Avionics System Engineer

profile_positions.location: São José dos Campos Area, Brazil
profile_positions.description: Over 10 years as EWIS Design Engineer, I´ve developed the full capabilities, such as functional design, which means I was designing Complex Wiring Diagrams and developing Harnesses. Defining proper electrical components to be part of BoM. CAD software’s which I´ve experienced were Microstation, Mentor Graphics and IGE-XAO. Electrical Wiring Installation Design, where I had the opportunity to design safe wiring routing installation for static and dynamic cable bundles, installed in harsh environment. Circuit break panels, identification placards. CAD software’s which I´ve experienced were CATIA V4 and V5. • ICD – Interface Control Document reader and writer; • Electrical design for the following aircraft systems: Fuel System, Entertainment System, Avionics, Power Plant, and Flight Controls; • Analysis of EWIS components environmental qualification, according to DO-160; • Systems design Integration and zonal analysis; • Identification of potential issues with component / assembly designs and manufacturing processes; • Support for shop floor, and final product line integration; • Problem solving and troubleshooting experience in field; • Definition of EWIS maintenance concepts and visual inspection; • Coordination with customers, suppliers, and interdepartmental personnel; • Member of the AOG (Aircraft on ground) group, for quick (in 4 hours) and reliable technical solutions for customers in the field; • Change management; • SAP as user; Achievements: 1- Leading Design Integration of multidisciplinary engineering groups and other departments such as, Wiring Diagram and Installation, Interiors, Structures, Air Condition, Fuel, Power-plant, Cabin Entertainment, Human factors, Maintenance plan, After Market, Supply-chain, Program mgt, for several developments. 2- Founder of the first Electrical Design Engineering Community of Practice for Knowledge Managment.
profile_positions.title: Senior EWIS Design Engineer

profile_positions.location: São José dos Campos Area, Brazil
profile_positions.description:
As founder of this company and passionate by the art of the communication and by people, I'd enjoyed several years, with a great team, who I devoted my gratitude for been supported the company growing.
Accomplished human resource by recruiting, selecting, orienting, training, assigning, scheduling, coaching, counseling, and disciplining employees, communicating job expectations, planning, monitoring, appraising, and reviewing job contributions, planning and reviewing compensation actions, enforcing policies and procedures with a small team 15 direct employees and 60 monthly indirect. 
Professional with strong knowledge on:
•	Definition of marketing and sales operational objectives to come with strategic plans, preparing and completing action plans, implementing production, productivity, quality, and customer-service standards, resolving problems, completing audits, identifying trends, determining system improvements, implementing changes. 
•	Determination annual and gross-profit plans by forecasting and developing annual sales quotas for regions, projecting expected sales volume and profit for existing and new products, analyzing trends and results, establishing pricing strategies, recommending selling prices, monitoring costs, competition, supply, and demand. 
•	Creation of marketing opportunities by identifying consumer requirements, defining market and competitor's share, and competitor's strengths and weaknesses, forecasting projected business, establishing targeted market share. 
•	Improved product marketability and profitability by researching, identifying, and capitalizing on market opportunities; 
•	Improving product packaging, coordinating new creative product development. 
•	Sustained rapport with key accounts by making periodic visits, exploring specific needs, anticipating new opportunities. 
•	Knowledge management process implementation
profile_positions.title: CEO Founder

profile_positions.description: As head of Villa Branca Magazine I was leading a team composed by Art Director, Publisher, Journalists, Photographers, Media assistant, sales and finance. This monthly Magazine led me to establish a production process, to make sure every month the Magazine would be delivered to readers on time. The basis of the management was partly home office based for some of our contribuitors. This Magazine had an indice of acceptance higher than 99%, just allowed due to an extensive definition of the customer value proposition, creating no just a Magazine but a brand that customers and readers identify with.
profile_positions.title: CEO Founder

profile_positions.location: São José dos Campos Area, Brazil
profile_positions.description: Over 3 years at SAE BRASIL as Board member, being spokes person in universities and events. I´ve proposed the first SAE Knowleged Management Symposium where I figured out as chairperson. In this role the following activies has been lead by me. - Prospection of Sponsors and Business Partners - Development and Discussion of Communication Plan - Invitation to Speakers - Budget management - Invitation Letter Definition - Structure and place definition Our sponsors were companies listed as 1000 biggest companies in Brazil, great keynote speakers, a lot of content and networking were part of the day. volunteer_experiences.description:
I'm always excited about the deep tech startups and their challenges reason why I answered the call to join HighTech XL. As a serial entrepreneur Engineer every one on one talk or event becomes a win/win relationship.

High Tech XL has a prooffed framework to launch and accelerate any brillant invention, the wide networking brings knowledged and man power to the entrepreneur. I personally strong recommend them.

I´ve been coaching some excited entrepreneurs who have participated in Walk-to-Talk event promoted by The Gate.

It was a great pleasure to walk next to them, understand their needs and ambitions and fed them with new insights and recommendation for a new way forward filled with nice opportunities.

The coaching session was focused in business modeling with marketing and sales strategy, with strong focus in branding.

Looking forward for next coming entrepreneurs.

As a Mentor of Hello Mentor I'm happy to mentoring students on how to define their career goals and together we can design their own journey in order to achieve the goals with the best in results for their career and life. 

Hello Mentor is a organized and serious program which I strongly recommended, for the ones who wanna to join as a mentor or mentee. 😃

As a member of Director Board of the Vale do Paraíba branch, I was mainly involved in yearly planning, budgetary discussions, promotion of SAE by means of speeches in universities. 

I was the chairperson and mastermind behind of the first Knowledge Management Seminar. It was a great event with big players.
I'm currently member of AE-10 High Voltage Committee.
I'm member of the WG-116 - HIGH Voltage Systems and Components in Aviation working group.
